medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute abdominal pain with fever and left testicular pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced an acute onset of abdominal pain and fevers two days ago, with the pain increasing in intensity and migrating to the right lower quadrant on the day of presentation. Associated symptoms include anorexia and acute left-testicular pain, which prompted the patient to visit the emergency department.
